p: Infrastructural planning has been reshaping the topography of Venice and its lagoon for ages, affecting the footpaths and waterways that contribute to the identity of the city and its inhabitants. The example of Venice shows that cruise infrastructures are a fundamental component of social order. By connecting their spatial knowledge to contested infrastructures, the movement Comitato No Grandi Navi has become a considerable voice in local politics. It has also managed to turn the cruise ship into a symbol representing this process.
